trans-unit.source: Encapsulates properties related to scrolling.
This is an abstract class.

The actual derived classes used directly by Windows Forms are <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HScrollProperties> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VScrollProperties>, which are returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.HorizontalScroll%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.VerticalScroll%2A> properties of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties"></xref> class.
You cannot instantiate this class directly, as it is abstract.
You must instantiate one of its derived classes instead, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HScrollProperties> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VScrollProperties>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl"></xref> whose scrolling properties this object describes.
Gets or sets whether the scroll bar can be used on the container.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the scroll bar can be used; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the distance to move a scroll bar in response to a large scroll command.
LargeChange is used to determine how far the scroll bar is moved in response to a request to move a considerable distance, such as when the user presses the PAGE UP or PAGE DOWN button.
An <xref:System.Int32> describing how far, in pixels, to move the scroll bar in response to a large change.
LargeChange cannot be less than zero.
Gets or sets the upper limit of the scrollable range.
If the new value of Maximum is less than <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Minimum%2A>, then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Minimum%2A> is set equal to Maximum.
An <xref:System.Int32> representing the maximum range of the scroll bar.
Gets or sets the lower limit of the scrollable range.
If the new value of Minimum is greater than <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Maximum%2A>, then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollProperties.Maximum%2A> is set equal to Minimum.
An <xref:System.Int32> representing the lower range of the scroll bar.
Minimum cannot be less than zero.
Gets the control to which this scroll information applies.
The control to which this scroll information applies.
Gets or sets the distance to move a scroll bar in response to a small scroll command.
SmallChange is used to calculate how far to move the scroll bar in response to an arrow key click or a click on a scroll bar button.
An <xref:System.Int32> representing how far, in pixels, to move the scroll bar.
Gets or sets a numeric value that represents the current position of the scroll bar box.
An <xref:System.Int32> representing the position of the scroll bar box, in pixels.
Gets or sets whether the scroll bar can be seen by the user.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if it can be seen; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
